shippingstore

Class UserDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • shippingstore.UserDatabase

  • public class UserDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent a database interface for a list of User's. It using a serial file "UserDB.ser" to store and write package order objects in readable text form. It contains an ArrayList called userList to store the database in a runtime friendly data structure. The userList is written to "UserDB.ser" at the end of the UserDatabase object's life by calling flush(). This class also provides methods for adding, remove, and searching for users from the list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserDatabase()
      This constructor is hard-coded to open "UserDB.txt" and initialize the packageOrderList with its contents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserDatabase

        public UserDatabase()
             throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is hard-coded to open "UserDB.txt" and initialize the packageOrderList with its contents. If no such file exists, then one is created. The contents of the file are "loaded" into the packageOrderList ArrayList in no particular order. The file is then closed during the duration of the program until flush() is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the FileInputStream cannot find a file - handled

    • Method Detail

      • showUsers

        public void showUsers()
        Method showUsers displays the current list of Users in the Arraylist in the order they are in storage

      • findUser

        public int findUser(java.lang.String idNumber)
        This method can be used to find a user in the Arraylist of users.
        Parameters:
        idNumber - a String that represents the id number of the order that to be searched for.
        Returns:
        the int index of the package orders in the Arraylist of orders, or -1 if the search failed.

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String type,
                    java.lang.String idNumber,
                    java.lang.String firstName,
                    java.lang.String lastName,
                    java.lang.String special1,
                    java.lang.String special2,
                    java.lang.String special3)
        This method is used to add a user to the userList ArrayList. In order for a user to be added to the ArrayList it must comply with the following:

        1. The user is not already in the ArrayList according to the ID number as the unique key.

        2. The ID number is 6 digit numeric value

        3. The Type of the user can be only one of the following: Employee or Customer

        4. For Employees: Social security

        Parameters:
        type - the String which represents the type of user to be added
        idNumber - the String which represents the user's ID number
        firstName - the String that is the user's first name
        lastName - the String that is the user's last name
        special1 - the String that is either the employee's social or the Customer's phone number
        special2 - the String that is either the employee's monthly salary OR the customer's address
        special3 - the String that is either the employee's account number for direct deposit OR ignored for customer typed users

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(java.lang.String idNum)
        This method will remove a user from the userList ArrayList. It will remove the instance of a user that matches ID number that was passed to this method. If no such user exists, it will produce an error message.
        Parameters:
        idNum - the String ID number of the user to be removed.

      • getUser

        public User getUser(int i)
        This method is used to retrieve the User object from the userList at a given index.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the desired User object.
        Returns:
        the PackageOrder object at the index or null if the index is invalid.

      • getUserType

        public java.lang.String getUserType(int i)
        This method returns the type of user in the userList at the given index
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the desired User
        Returns:
        the String description of the type of user

      • updateUserInfo

        public void updateUserInfo(int index,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String field,
                           java.lang.String update)
        This method is used to change a user's info after they have already been added to the userList
        Parameters:
        index - an int that represents the index of the user in the array list
        type - a String that represents the type of user to be updated
        field - a String that represents the type of information being updated
        update - a String that represents the updated information

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        This method opens "UserDB.ser" and overwrites it with a serialization of all the users in the userList. This should be the last method to be called before exiting the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
